Mount Keen

Hear pronunciation Press to hear pronunciation

Mount Keen is the most easterly of the Munros, a cone-shaped summit rearing above the great sea of the Mounth plateau. It can be climbed quickly from Glen Esk, or more scenically via Glen Tanar.

 You have not climbed Mount Keen.

Region: Angus

Altitude: 939 metres

Users' Rating:
  • Currently 3.11/5
Rating: 3.1/5 (169 votes cast)

You must be registered and signed-in to vote

Detailed route description and map

Mount Keen from Invermark, Glen Esk

Mount Keen from Glen Tanar

Other routes and challenges

The two routes above account for almost all ascents - with that from Glen Esk via Glen Mark being considerably shorter than the northerly approach by the pinewoods of Glen Tanar.

Walker-friendly accommodation in the area

Angus Hotels

Angus B&B

Angus Cottages

Angus Hostels

There are 9252 Walkhighlanders who have climbed Mount Keen. They have contributed 154 public walk reports including this summit. These are ordered below with the most popular ones first.
